line.en: '...Today didn't go well either.'
Today's breakfast was another dismal failure.
All of the boarders showed up for breakfast. But,\nthe only one who finished her meal was Kanako.
'There must've been something wrong with it...'
All I have to do is make meals and clean, what a\npiece of cake!
is what I thought when I accepted the job as dorm\nmother, but my confidence is gradually fading.
'What are you brooding over, you traitor?'
'...What do you want?'
Masatsugu, joining me on the way to school, went\nout of his way to come and sling verbal abuse.
'A few things happened at the dormitory. Dealing\nwith girls can be tough.'
'In that case, you should talk to me! That's\nbecause I have a girlfriend!'
'Yeah, yeah. Isn't she a freshman at Seisen girls\nschool?'
Seisen Girls High School is a school for rich\ngirls and is famous even in this neighborhood.
The uniform has a reputation for being cute, so\n'fans' come from far and wide just to take a\nlook.
'Her name's Eri-chan, do you wanna see a photo?'
He looks like he's about to show me, so I go\nalong with it.
'Whoa!! Seriously, she's cute...!!'
'Isn't she?'
'We're in a band together. Eri-chan's on vocals\nand bass and I'm on guitar!'
'Ma-bou, you can play guitar?'
'I practiced like crazy for Eri-chan. Now I can\nplay as fast as Yngwie!'
Da ra ra ra! he goes as he shows off some great\nair guitar.
Anyway, who the hell is Yngwie?
'Hey, at your old school, you were riding bikes\nweren't you?'
'Yeah, I was. What about it?'
'So, you're not doing it anymore? We even don't\nhave a Cycle Racing Club at our school,\nthough...'
'Yeah, I don't do it anymore.'
'Hmmm.'
Masatsugu's face seemed to say 'It's got nothing\nto do with me though'.
'...Didn't you get on the podium at some huge\nrace meet?'
'Did you hear that from An-chan?'
'An-chan told Ageha and Hotaru that they should\ngo with him and cheer for you at the next race.'
'Well... he told me too...'
That made me go a bit red.
'Hey, don't get the wrong idea! I wanted to go to\nwatch you lose miserably.'
'I wasn't planning on going so that I could cheer\nfor you or anything!'
'Yeah, yeah, I get it. Don't get so flustered.'
'Ageha felt bad about it. That she couldn't see\nyou... at your best.'
'You knew about that, didn't you?'
'No, I didn't know.'
I never thought that I would make it to the\npodium.
Even if I knew, it was too far away for me to say\n'Come and watch me!'.
'Even so, you still didn't contact us!'
'Same goes for both of us. Besides, I sent you a\nNew Year card every year, didn't I?'
'You mean the pre-printed ones they sell at the\nconvenience store!?'
'You did the same thing! Anyway, your New Year\ncards usually arrive at the end of January!'
'You should just be thankful that I send you one\nback, you...!'
'Oh, I've found the odd couple!'
'Tsk!'
'Hi, Ageha.'
'Morning!'
'Hmm? What's up, Ma-bou?'
Masatsugu was sneakily hiding in my shadow.
'It's... nothing. Don't get too friendly with me,\nor Eri-chan will get angry.'
'OK, OK. She's such a cute, cute girlfriend,\nisn't she?'
Jokingly, Ageha deliberately keeps her distance\nfrom Masatsugu as she walks.
Masatsugu comes up beside me, and gives me a\nlittle poke in the ribs.
'(...That thing we were talking about just now,\ndon't say anything to Ageha, OK?)'
'(...What thing?)'
'(About the fact that she wanted to go and watch\nyour race.)'
'(OK, I got it.)'
Is it the sort of thing that needs to be kept a\nsecret?
'Why are two guys like you getting so clingy?'
'Wh...whadya mean? Who'd wanna get near this guy?\nPtoo! Ptoo!'
'Ewww, gross! You don't have to actually spit!'
'Eh heh heh, you're getting along so well. I'm so\njealous!'
'Shut up, Ageha!'
'Yeah, don't say weird things like that!'
Lunchtime.
'Today, I didn't eat my lunchbox early.'
As I basked in this tiny sense of achievement and\ngot my lunch box out, Kotori had already\ndisappeared from the classroom.

As she looked out into the hallway, she was
pacing back and forth, as if she were thinking
'Should I go forward.. no... maybe I should go
back?'.
'Are you waiting for me?'
'Aaaargh!'
Letting out a cry not really befitting a pretty\nlittle girl, Kotori fanned herself with her left\nhand as if to calm herself down.
'D...don't scare me like that!'
'Sorry. I only wanted to speak to you, that's\nall.'
'You're going, aren't you? To the garage?'
'Yes, I am. ...It's not like I'm waiting for you\nthough.'
'OK, shall we go?'
I push her wheelchair on the way.
'Huh, hey! Don't just start pushing me!'
'Here, hold this, would you?'
I pass my bag to her.
'Hey, don't treat me like baggage storage!'
'...Looks like nobody's here.'
The garage was open but there was no one there.
For some reason, it felt like Amane was always\nhere, so it was a little surprising.
The air conditioning's not turned on, so it's\nquite humid.
'What should we do?'
'...Why are you asking me?'
Kotori subconsciously put her hand on her\nstomach.
'Shall we have our lunch in here? I made one for\nyou too, Kotori.'
Well, I meant leftovers from breakfast.
Kotori didn't come to breakfast, so she shouldn't\nhave any way of knowing what I made.
'...Is this also part of your job as dorm\nmother?'
'Hmm? No, I'm just meddling.'
I put the three lunch boxes on the workbench.
'I went to the trouble of making one for Amane\ntoo, though.'
The air conditioner isn't turned on in the\ngarage, so if I just leave it here, it'll go bad.

There's a refrigerator, so I decide to put it in
there. If I leave a note on the desk, she'll
realize it is in there and then eat it, won't
she?
'Could you turn on the electric fan?'
Kotori turns on the nearby electric fan.
'What about the air conditioner?'
'I can't find the remote controller.'
It's probably buried somewhere.
We open up the lunchboxes in the area that gets\nthe full force of the wind from the electric fan.
'What's this? ...Curry?'
This morning's breakfast was curry.
'You don't like it?'
'Do people usually put curry in their\nlunchboxes?'
'You can complain after you've eaten it.'
Kotori has a meek look on her face as she moves\nthe cold curry towards her mouth.
'...It's tasty even though it's cold.'
'It would be good if we had a microwave though.'
For a little while, the two of us quietly eat our\ncurry.
Today, there is no sheet covering the glider.
I gazed at the simple, sleek shape of its body\nand thought it was beautiful.
I imagined the aircraft cutting through the air\nas it flew.
'When riding a bicycle, your greatest enemy is\nthe wind.'
Kotori's face seemed to say 'What is this guy\ntalking about all of a sudden?' but I carry on\nregardless.
'The worst thing is when you have a headwind.\nWhile it is constantly pushing you back, you have\nto keep pedaling.'
I face the wind coming through the electric fan,\nset to 'strong', and I remember that feeling a\nlittle.
The feeling of the wind gradually draining my\nstamina.
'That's why when we ride a bicycle, we try to\nfind ways to reduce air resistance.'
Not just the shape of the bike or the helmet.
During the race, we cooperate with the members of\nother teams, and form a group while riding.
I thought that when riding a bike, it would be\nbetter if the wind wouldn't blow.
'But this thing rides the wind to fly.'
'Even though it doesn't have a jet engine or a\npropeller.'
If we hadn't actually seen it flying that day,\neven with the real thing right in front of us, we\nwouldn't be able to imagine it flying.
'Speaking of which, Kotori, how do you know so\nmuch about gliders?'
She didn't really know that much about them; that\nwas the first time she had seen a real one.
'I don't really. I just... read about them in a\nbook.'
Somehow, it seems like it's hard for her to\nanswer, so I decide not to question any further.
Speaking of books, there's a bookshelf here,\nlined with many books.
Looking closely, they are all related to gliders\nor aircraft.
I pick one up and take a look inside.
'...It's all in English. I can't read it.'
It's not like my grades in English are bad, but\nwith the level of English I have from studying at\nschool, reading academic papers is really tough.
Seems like Kotori is the same.
'This book has lots of photos.'
There was a book that had many photos of gliders,\nlike a catalogue.
'There are so many different types.'
The shape of the wings, the size and so on.
Even with gliders, there are so many different\nvarieties.
'Look at this.'
'...What's happening in this picture?'
'It's flying over a mountain.'
It looked so natural that I didn't really notice,\nbut the glider was flying high enough that it\ncould look down on the mountain.
'They can fly that high!?'
Kotori and I, without realizing, both look at the\nglider sitting over there.

With its wings removed, we couldn't really grasp
the full size of it, but at a glance, it didn't
seem all that different compared to the glider in
the photo.
Amane had said that it could go above the\nclouds...
'I wonder what it feels like, to fly through the\nsky.'
'It probably feels amazing. To fly on the rising\nair currents, it must feel like being a bird,\nwouldn't it?'
After we finished our lunchboxes, we stayed for a\nlittle longer.
We spent the time looking at books and admiring\nthe glider.
When the bell rang, it felt like the time to\nenjoy ourselves was over, and I felt a little\nsad.
'Hmm? What's this?'
Just as we were about to go back to the\nclassroom, Kotori noticed a photo frame on\nAmane's desk.
'...I wonder what this is?'
The weird thing was that there was a photo frame,\nbut no photo inside.
An empty photo frame had been placed there.
'In her case, she probably managed to lose just\nthe photo inside.'
'What's up?'
'Huh? No, it's nothing. Let's go. It's hot in\nhere, I can't stand it.'
The moment we stepped out of the sauna-like\ngarage, the air outside felt cool.
Splash, splash, splash...
'Whew...'
'Ahhh...I'm worn out!'
It's easy to say 'clean the bathroom' but I never\nthought it would be such a big job.
Plus, there's no air conditioning in there, so\nI'm sweltering.
'The trouble is, if I don't do this every day\nduring the summer time, then mold will start\ngrowing.'
It's not just about hygiene, it's kind of gross\ntoo; there's no way you can take a bath when\nthere's mold growing in there.
My cell phone rang.
On the display, it showed 'Home'.
'Hello?'
'Hello, Aoi? It's me.'
'What's up?'
'Nothing really. I was just wondering how you're\ndoing. How is it? Is it going smoothly?'
'I can't say that it's going smoothly. I didn't\nthink of it much when I accepted the job. But, it\nturned out to be pretty tough.'
'Yes, of course. There's no such thing as an easy\njob.'
'Going to school every day and doing the work of\na dorm mother is wearing me out...'
I realized this after only a few days.
This is a lot of hard work.
'But now, that's better for you isn't it?'
'Why?'
'You can do it without dredging up old memories.'
'Well... If that's what you think, don't talk\nabout it.'
'Or do you miss your mama?'
'A mother like you...?'
She's the kind of mother who loves teasing her\nson.
But...
'(Did she get me to do this dorm mother job\nbecause she was worried about me?)'
I'm so busy that I don't have time to dwell on\nthings.
Speaking in the hallway, the other boarders may\nhave been able to hear me, so I went back to my\nroom.
We continue our silly parent-child conversation.
My mother is a fiercely independent person and a\nhardworking career woman.
Many things have been happening until recently...\nWell, they're still going on now, and we were\nliving separately.
I'm a bit too old to be missing my mother though.
It's enough for me to just speak to her from time\nto time.
'How's school?'
'It's going fine. Ageha is there too.'
'Ageha-chan, she's gotten so pretty hasn't she?\nRecently, I saw her for the first time in a\nwhile, and I was so surprised!'
'...Me too. She's like a proper girl now.'
'Sheesh, you won't be able to think about her\nlike that for much longer!'

'Ageha-chan will get even prettier from now on,
won't she? She's outgoing and considerate, so
she'll be very popular with the boys, no doubt
about it!'
'Geez, cut it out! What are you talking about?'
'Now, now, you have such a sharp tongue. You\nremind me of someone...'
'Yeah, you.'
Would a mother usually tell her son to go chasing\nafter girls?
'OK then, good luck. If you have any trouble,\ncall me.'
'Sure.'
'Also, if you're finding it tough to do all of\nthe housework, you can ask the boarders to help\nyou.'
'The rent in that place is super cheap, so they\nshould help with things like that.'
'I'll think about it.'
'OK, good night, Aoi-chan!'
She called me that on purpose because she knows I\ndon't like it, and then ended the call.

My father is the one who chose to call me 'Aoi'
but it's kind of a girl's name, so I was often
teased about it, and it seems she still
remembers.
I put down my phone and take a look at the\nboarding student's roster.

As for the boarders' jobs, cleaning their own
room is a given, then there is cleaning the
hallways and entrance, as well as the dining
hall.

On the other hand, my jobs are to prepare
breakfast and dinner, clean up afterwards, clean
the bathroom and the garden and other
miscellaneous chores.
'It is actually pretty tough, maybe I should ask\nfor some help.'
Even if I can just get them to clean the\nbathroom, that would be a real lifesaver.
'Yuka?'
'Y...yes?'

Yuka, who is in the dining hall, is the tall,
fourth-year, and the one who has been here the
longest. She seems surprised as I call out to
her.
'...What is it, Aoi?'
'Can I ask you a question?'
I lay out the roster that I was just looking at\non the table where Yuka is sitting.
Yuka, who should be used to seeing this, looks at\nit with curiosity.
'Kotori doesn't have her name on the job\nroster...'
Starting with Kanako, then Yuka, there are four\nnames, but Kotori's name is not there.
'Huh? Yes, but... she...'
Yuka looks towards the dining hall door as she\nspeaks.
'...She's disabled.'
'I see, so that's why. Thank you.'
'It's OK...'
